data.title: Fix decaying units
data.body:
Decaying units face correct direction and disappear after a short time.

Im not sure how the original engine knows which units decay based on gamedata, so it will just check for unit names ending in "_D" for now.

data.title: Replace GLEW with libepoxy
data.body:
This removes the dependency on X11, and allows for a much more future-proof OpenGL context, with core, GLES, EGL and everything supported, see https://github.com/anholt/libepoxy#why-not-use-libglew

Also drops the cmake version required back to 2.8.8.

data.title: c++14-ize constexpr functions for string modification
data.body:
Now that we have c++14-support, the fancy constexpr functions can be written more readable.

https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/7061e8bf1e54df177981415cd242f2d1dbf69ef1/cpp/util/constexpr.h

http://isocpp.org/files/papers/N3652.html

data.title: Logger
data.body:
Finally, the new™ logging system, all ready to be reviewed to shreds.

Old `cpp/log.h` has been replaced by `cpp/log/log.h`, which provides the `MSG` macro and `openage::log::log()`.

Example usage:

```
log::log(MSG(err) << "test error message " << 1337)
my_unit.log(MSG(dbg) << "this message will be logged by the unit");
throw util::Error(MSG(err) << "exceptions use the MSG system as well!")
```

See `doc/implementation/logger.md`.

Main step towards #48
Closes #50
Closes #171

data.title: WIP - Coords testing & Tile.get_pos_on_chunk fix
data.body:
Added testing for the coord system
Fixed Tile.get_pos_on_chunk to return the position of the tile on the chunk. This will be an int 0-15. It does not look like this changes anything with the game as it does not seem to be used anywhere. Let me know if you find any problems with it.

data.title: Casesensitivity fixes
data.body:
Probably closes #243 and finally resolves #55.

Implements case insensitive file name fetching for the whole conversion process.

Please test on all plattforms and game versions, especially @dopsi @Almin17 and @SkySkimmer are encouraged to try whether this branch works for them.

@goto-bus-stop, please review the HD support of this, I can't test it because of a lacking installation.

data.title: Bountysource github plugin
data.body:
Hi.

I think you should consider adding the Bountysource.com github plugin on your github pages to let people place bounties on their favorite issues more easily.

Once installed, the plugin will make your github pages look like that (bounty values in titles and "Bounty" tags): https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues?direction=desc&labels=bounty&page=1&sort=updated&state=open
If I remember, there are options to only display bounties in the title, or only tags, or both.. etc.

Here is doc (about how to integrate it on github):
http://blog.bountysource.com/post/48954271533/improved-github-integration-automatically-update

Thank you for your project !

data.title: Stub some unused, unimplemented stuff on WIN32 so it can compile
data.body: Cleaner, fresher form of #207. Won't harm current platforms :)

data.title: [WIP] Crosscompile with MinGW, run with WINE
data.body:
![mingw-wine-gaben](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/726447/6183035/3e8ae5a2-b32e-11e4-8565-dbd96973e336.png)

> mfw Terminal Terminal Terminal

this is a somewhat dirty branch on which i'm testing cross compiling on linux to mingw-w64 :dancer:

based on mappu's work on #9 and former work at #207. also [this unnamed branch similar to mappu's guide](https://github.com/franciscod/openage/tree/a4519112381fe7dd8ceed3377d620dc548064d07) 

---
## Prerequisites
- You can build and run openage on your native platform without issues
- You have Wine and mingw-w64 installed plus all the dependencies in their mingw crosscompiled form [example: AUR](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/?K=mingw-w64))
## The four super hard steps to see gaben under wine

```
$ ./buildsystem/mingw-configure    # generates config.h, we're not using cmake yet
$ ./buildsystem/mingw-build-simple # compiles
$ ./buildsystem/mingw-deploy       # copies .exe and dlls
$ ./buildsystem/mingw-run-wine     # calls wine with fontconfig settings
```

---
## Issues (need help!)
- [x] compile with a simple build script based on `buildsystem/simple` (`buildsystem/mingw-build-simple`)
- [x] fix the fontconfig slow loading at startup
- [ ] improve the random fontconfig solution (see the `buildsystem/mingw-run-wine` envvar)
- [ ] integrate cleanly with cmake instead of breaking `configure`
- [ ] find a way to package it for bare windows7 (xp? vista?) 32bit (with dlls and every dep needed)
- [ ] fix skewed gaben texture

data.title: Avoid merge conflicts in copying.md author list
data.body:
The most common merge conflict are names in copying.md.

The only solution for this i can think of is creating a `contributors/` directory containing one file for each contributor, which contains further info in a yet-to-be-determined format.

This will finally stop all the merge conflicts in the author list. What do you think? Other ideas?

data.title: Make the code compliance Makefile targets selective
data.body: `make checkfull` takes roughly 10 seconds to run here.  If there was a way to only check files that were modified, it would be more practical to run code compliance checks as a commit hook.  That would lead to less frustration with pull requests failing to build because of things like copyright headers not being up to date.
